lexUnit.name: quiver.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: shake or tremble with a slight rapid motion

sentence.text: She could hear the concern in his voice , and her lower lip quivered .
His lashes quivered but did n't lift , and she saw that his lips had parted to reveal his teeth .
Sam quivered with suspense .
He quivered with uncontrolled mirth , and Juliet found herself smiling .
His temples were quivering with riotous indignation and his deep-set eyes flashed about behind the long , sweaty strands of hair that fell forward from his centre parting .
Ingmar 's big bushy eyebrows quivered with indignation like two chilly black mice .
His face was quivering with anger .
Churchill shook his head sorrowfully , his fleshy jowls quivering in agitation .
Her bottom lip quivered in surprise and horror .
The nurse 's chin quivered in indignation as she reported that the girl was no more than a child .
Even the glasses on top of the cigarette vending machine quivered in time to the music .
Tall eagle feathers quivered in their war bonnets .
If the telescope is mounted upon a spidery stand , it will quiver charmingly in the slightest breeze , and the image will dance about so violently that it will be useless .
Shadows quivered in his fallen cheeks .
Wolsey just quivered in terror , shaking like one of the jellies his chefs had so recently served us .
Unwilling to make an unheralded entrance , Nicandra quivered in a distance of expectancy .
Amabel 's chin had quivered .
` We have to talk about this rationally , " she tried , her body quivering from his onslaught .
But he was looking at her with a dark intensity that made her nerves quiver very oddly .
The muscles in his neck were quivering .
It seemed to me that something like a wink quivered for an instant over one of Mr . Baynes 's tiny eyes .
